aiAnalysis.summary: AFJ Limited's staging environment demonstrates good authentication controls with all admin endpoints properly protected (403 responses), and HTTPS is correctly implemented. However, there is a critical gap in security headers across all pages—essential protections like X-Content-Type-Options and X-Frame-Options are missing from most endpoints, leaving the application vulnerable to MIME-type sniffing and clickjacking attacks. Additionally, recommended security headers (HSTS, CSP, Referrer-Policy, Permissions-Policy) are absent across the board, which significantly weakens the overall security posture.
recommendations: Immediately add X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff header to all pages to prevent MIME-type sniffing attacks
Add X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN (or DENY) header to all pages to prevent clickjacking; note the /admin page has this set correctly—replicate this configuration
Implement Strict-Transport-Security header (e.g., max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains) across all pages to enforce HTTPS
Deploy Content-Security-Policy header with strict directives appropriate for a transport service application to prevent XSS and injection attacks
Add Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin header to protect sensitive URL information
Add Permissions-Policy header to restrict access to browser features (camera, microphone, geolocation) that may be unnecessary for this application
Conduct a full audit of the production environment (not just staging) to ensure these headers are implemented consistently
Review and test the CSP policy to ensure it doesn't break legitimate functionality while providing maximum protection
